intro: Convolvulus huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén convolvulus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Andean regions of Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes vines and herbs characterized by their trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals that curve inward, and it produces small, round berries as fruit. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
